events.title: George Washington Appointed Commander-in-Chief
events.description: The Second Continental Congress appointed George Washington as the commander-in-chief of the Continental Army during the American Revolutionary War.
events.significance: This appointment marked the beginning of Washington's military leadership that would eventually lead to American independence.

events.title: Battle of Gettysburg Ends
events.description: The decisive battle of Gettysburg concluded with Union forces defeating the Confederate Army, marking a turning point in the American Civil War.
events.significance: The victory helped to halt the Confederate invasion of the North and boosted Union morale.

events.title: U.S. Census Bureau Declares the Frontier Closed
events.description: The U.S. Census Bureau announced that the American frontier was no longer discernible, marking the end of westward expansion.
events.significance: This declaration symbolized the closing of a significant chapter in American history and the beginning of the modern era.

events.description: During a visit to Canada, de Gaulle's proclamation supported Quebec's independence movement, stirring diplomatic tensions.
events.significance: The speech intensified debates over Quebec sovereignty and strained Franco-Canadian relations.

events.title: Live 8 Concerts Held Worldwide
events.description: A series of benefit concerts took place globally to raise awareness of poverty in Africa and pressure G8 leaders to increase aid.
events.significance: The concerts mobilized international attention and influenced policy discussions on global poverty.
